content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very easy puzzle which could be done in less than 10 minutes in python.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Looks good to me, maybe easy but best for a puzzle.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Le problème est facile et bien décrit.
L'auteur est réactif
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

Hello,
Thank you for this very easy problem
In Validators you should add one having length near 1000 since that is what is said in Constraints
Cheers

j'ai pas compris la valeur de sorti que tu demander
<<>> c'est 4

Goal and Output sections
* Suggest you to format < and > and 0 (the output for no prefix found) as constants.
* Please change "there's no" (Goal section) and "there is no" (Output section) to "there is not"

Goal section
* Please add a full-stop after the first sentence.
* Please specify that {{<}} must precede the corresponding {{>}} so {{<>}} is valid while {{><}} is not.
* Please specify that nested expressions are valid.

Constraints section
* Suggest you NOT to format the upper and lower bounds (1 and 100000). I think no formatting is needed.
* Please change "a single expression" to "[[line]]".

Thanks.

Hello!
It seems like you search for the longest valid string in the whole sentence but we have to search from the first char to the last so ><<>> should print 0 instead of 4
Also, when a string is well formatted but the sentence not be fully analyzed we have to continue to search and not break so <><> should print 4 instead of 2
I've replaced the tags "Parsing" and "Compiler" with "parenthesis".
